message.content:
We must “close‐out” (i.e. finalize) the expense total for the income statement by adding together all “expense” items (including Depreciation) but not other types (for example “Sale” – which are revenues – and “Purchase” – which are capital/inventory or asset transactions). In our table the rows whose “type” begins with “Expense” (or “Depreciation”) are the ones that we add.
